Tribe.name: Tyo
Tribe.description: You are Tyo - and come from a part of Pepolis known as the Watching Cliffs, which overlooks one of the planet’s seas. Your tribe shapes Pepolis's weather by guiding the god Tyo’kuric, known as The Intense Storm

Tribe.name: Hijka
Tribe.description: You are Hijka - a nomadic tribe that follows and protects Hem’Kijka, a swarm of a thousand insects traveling across Pepolis and destroying invasive fauna or anything that might affect life on the planet.

Tribe.name: Skia
Tribe.description: You are Skia - a tribe of academics and scientists that reside on the mountain and M'Ekina known as Tkem'Skia, or The Voice of God. This is the name given to the giant ship of a forerunner species that is the source of much of the Pepel's early technological progress.

Tribe.name: Cu’Rr’Al
Tribe.description: You are Cu’Rr’Al - the tribe closest to the great spawning pools that bring the Pepel to life. Joyful and peaceful, your tribe worships the great M'Ekina Curannnallsi - the water spirit goddess that watches over the waters of Pepolis.

Tribe.name: Skro
Tribe.description: You are Skro - forest wanderers regarded as great harvesters and gatherers. Your worship the great M’Ekina Skrallw, the Life Giver. A sixteen-legged beast the size of a mountain that rolls over forests, plains and pastures and collecting any food it encounters. The Skro rely on it for sustenance.

Tribe.name: Mekt
Tribe.description: You are Mekt - a tribe shaped into formidable warriors by the relentless attacks of The Death God, M'Ekina Tkem’Mekt. Each time its agents were unleashed, the Mekt were forced to confront them. Their victories ultimately protected the Pepel species from eradication early in their evolution.

Tribe.name: Quanian
Tribe.description: You are Quanian - the only tribe not to serve a M'Ekina. Your tribe built the first city on Pepolis: Q'Ua - now the largest and most prosperous on the planet. It is home to the ruling authority on Pepolis: The Keepers of the Node. Without M'Ekina to worship, the Quanian cultivated their own belief system focused on improving the Pepelian species.

Origin.name: Aateos
Origin.description: Carved out of one of the many blocks that exist in the Outer Blocks, Aateos (Block 447,305) has become a massive city that shelters those who have a distaste for authority and the trivialities found in the Etherchain.

Origin.name: Central Block
Origin.description: A giant block drifting on the edge of Chainspace, constructed by a forerunner society dedicated to the study of the blocks, the blockworms, and the end of space. It is now a Temple and site of study and analysis.

Origin.name: Azshtttrokk
Origin.description: AKA, The Host. A city built and grown within the carcass of an ancient Blockworm and home to many of the Blockeater Tribes

Origin.name: Hued Forests
Origin.description: A lush landscape floating atop the Mempool, and littered with many waterways.

Origin.name: Deepmem
Origin.description: A region in the vast depths of the Mempool that is so deep as to transmute water into crystal.

Origin.name: Loclouds
Origin.description: The cloudy regions at the Mempool's outer bounds. Responsible for facilitating the Mempool's continual rejuvenation.

Origin.name: Genesis Cube
Origin.description: The vast construct whose explosion released the Genesis Pills and seeded the creation of all Chainspace.

Origin.name: Durn
Origin.description: A ship graveyard. A planet of scrap parts that has become the Etherchain's largest junkyard.

Origin.name: Pepolis
Origin.description: The swampy homeworld of the Pepel, a sentient frog-like species with advanced technology

Origin.name: Krolos
Origin.description: A peaceful world of learning, governed by A.I. some say are the descendants of the ancient Flashbots.

Origin.name: Topheilia
Origin.description: Home of the Topheil, an insectoid race that has taken to preserving life found across Chainspace. They have turned their world into a conservatory for life of all kinds, where they look after each of the creatures they’ve collected.

Origin.name: Lusk
Origin.description: Sitting within an asteroid belt, Lusk is the name given to a space station that was originally created to monitor the movements of the belt, but now serves as a cosmic court to the settling of disputes across Chainspace.

Upbringing.name: Interstellar Nomad
Upbringing.description: You have grown as an interstellar nomad, traveling across Chainspace.

Upbringing.name: Rekker
Upbringing.description: Your ancestors were once rekt, their livelihoods destroyed. Now, you have nothing to lose, and have joined others like you to fight back against that system: taking what you can by force.

Upbringing.name: Bearbarian
Upbringing.description: You've honed a sentiment of doom and gloom into a powerful frenzy state, ready to be unleashed on the battlefield.

Upbringing.name: Doomskroler
Upbringing.description: You've trained with the Doomskroler Sekt, traveling across Chainspace to prophecize "The End"...or an end...any end will do.

Upbringing.name: Yield Farmer
Upbringing.description: You've grown up a yield farmer. Its a humble life, but you know it well.

Upbringing.name: Algorist
Upbringing.description: You've trained in the algorist arts, weaving algorithms together to produce incredible tapestries of light, sound, time and form.

Upbringing.name: Trader
Upbringing.description: Your life has been dedicated to the art of buying low and selling high as you trade goods across Chainspace.

Upbringing.name: Edgelord
Upbringing.description: You are self-proclaimed nobility, living at the edges of the universe.

Upbringing.name: Operator
Upbringing.description: You're well trained operating vehicles: whether through space, on air, sea or land.

Upbringing.name: Patcher
Upbringing.description: You grew up amongst Patchers, nomadic mechanics traveling between worlds to construct and tend to the yield engines communities rely on to boost their farm's yields

Gift.name: Diamond Hands
Gift.description: Whether through genetics, or a lifetime of extreme training, you possess diamond hands, and the heightened fortitude that comes with it

Gift.name: Apeblood
Gift.description: The blood of apes flows through your veins, and their strength is your strength

Gift.name: Frontrunner
Gift.description: You possess a vast awareness of the flow of transactions across Chainspace, and the reflexes to beat them into blockspace.

Gift.name: Galaxy Brain
Gift.description: Your intellect is so vast as to either span across galaxies, or contain them

Gift.name: Gweibond
Gift.description: Your very essence is deeply bound to The Gwei, and you can perceive events in Chainspace just before they occur.

Gift.name: Simptongued
Gift.description: You have a way with words, though they don't always get you the desired result

Faction.name: None
Faction.description: You owe allegiance to no one, content to navigate your own way through Chainspace.

Faction.name: Aave
Faction.description: The Protectors. The Aave faction both inhabit and protect V'alta K'unta, otherwise known as the Ghostlands, an odd reality fermenting in the belly of an ancient memwraith.

Faction.name: Alchemix
Faction.description: The Cloners. Alchemix deals in all sorts of trade and services, but their main source of income comes through cloning. They offer the people of Chainspace loans in return for an exact clone that can serve them until the debt is paid off.

Faction.name: Badger
Faction.description: The Smugglers. Badger deals in smuggling things across the Great Expanse by using their bridges, this includes the fractured pieces of Gods. Right now, the efforts of Badger are focussed on smuggling the fractured remains of the bitcoin godchain into the Etherchain

Faction.name: Uniswap
Faction.description: The Tinkerers. Stalwart followers of the Unigod, the agents of Uniswap believe that a balance must be maintained between centralization and decentralization, and that only through the guidance of the Unigod, such a thing is achievable.

Faction.name: Sushi
Faction.description: The Alchemists. Sushi believes that a single entity, like the Unigod, should not be responsible for the decentralization of Chainspace. Instead, unlike their rivals Uniswap, they believe the Unigod's mission and power should be distributed, accessible, and available to anyone who feels a calling for decentralization.

Faction.name: Temple
Faction.description: The Builders. Block by block they construct a Temple that is the size of a planet. A temple that will surely take thousands of years to complete, but will be a beacon to their mantra of "Stake & Chill".

Faction.name: Olympus
Faction.description: The Wayfarers. They of the Formless Mountain who seek to achieve a way of transcendence by collectively embodying a pure-state stability, which has long been thought of as impossible.

Faction.name: Yearn
Faction.description: The Patchers. Founded by the enigmatic patcher, Andre, Yearn pledges itself to the teachings and wisdom of the four yFus; Techne, Community, Transmission, and Dominion, and, of course, the Yearning Tree that created them. They traverse Chainspace, repairing the ancient yield tech relied on by communities for bountiful harvests.

Faction.name: Degenerators
Faction.description: The Criminals. A coalition of criminal clans - pirates, smugglers, cyphers and other riff raff, bound together for mutual protection across Chainspace's Outer Blocks.

Faction.name: Shadowpakt
Faction.description: The Destroyers. Agents of the Shadowchain, guided to do its bidding and achieve its aim of swallowing all Chainspace.

Faction.name: RATStribe
Faction.description: The Artists. Members of the RATStribe reject the overt commercialization of artistic practices, structuring their community around the mutual gifting of their creative expression.

Water Type.name: Coral
Water Type.description: You are made from the waters that ebb and flow through the coral regions, close to the Mempool's island archipelagos

Water Type.name: Sunstrider
Water Type.description: You are made from the sunkissed waterways that flow within the Mempool's islands

Water Type.name: Arctic
Water Type.description: You are made from the frigid waters at the Mempool's fringes.

Water Type.name: Tropic
Water Type.description: You are made from the warm waters that flow near the Mempool's center

Water Type.name: Shadowmarked
Water Type.description: Your are made from ashen waters corrupted by the Shadowchain's touch.

Form.name: Pepel
Form.description: The Pepel are humanoid frog-like creatures that are known for their intellect and their altruistic personalities.

Form.name: Hashmonk
Form.description: The Hashmonk are roughly humanoid water-based creatures made from the sentient waters of the Mempool.
